intro: Deverra scoparia subsp. scoparia, commonly known as the common thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its spiny, lobed leaves and purple to pink flower heads that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and is often found in dry, rocky soils. Its leaves are covered in fine hairs, and the flowers are arranged in a spherical cluster. It is a member of the Asteraceae family and is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in harsh environments.
